books.title: Kipps
books.author: H. G. Wells
books.summary: An orphan raised by his aunt and uncle struggles as a young man to integrate into upper class society after receiving a substantial inheritance from his grandfather.

books.title: Bulldog Drummond
books.author: H. C. McNeile
books.summary: A demobilized officer places a newspaper advert for adventure, and its response leads him to discover a conspiracy.

books.title: Elizabeth and Her German Garden
books.author: Elizabeth von Arnim
books.summary: The English wife of a German aristocrat recounts, through a series of diary entries, a year spent revitalizing the neglected garden of their estate.

books.title: Eminent Victorians
books.author: Lytton Strachey
books.summary: Four witty and biting biographies of Victorians that take aim at the moral superiority of their subject’s time.

books.title: Hindu Tales from the Sanskrit
books.author: S. M. Mitra
books.summary: Short stories and fables from the Sanskrit tradition.

books.title: A Damsel in Distress
books.author: P. G. Wodehouse
books.summary: A composer meets a young woman and tracks her down to a country manor, where a case of mistaken identity leads to comedy.

books.title: The Importance of Being Earnest
books.author: Oscar Wilde
books.summary: A comedy skewering Victorian high society.

books.title: The Book of Wonder
books.author: Lord Dunsany
books.summary: A collection of fantastical short stories.

books.title: Noli Me Tangere
books.author: José Rizal
books.summary: After years away studying in Europe, a man returns to his hometown in the Philippines, and plans to build a school for the improvement of the local population.

books.title: The King in Yellow
books.author: Robert W. Chambers
books.summary: Ten short stories of madness, hauntings, romance, and art.

books.title: My Disillusionment in Russia
books.author: Emma Goldman
books.summary: Emma Goldman recounts her experiences living in the early Soviet Union.

books.title: Scarhaven Keep
books.author: J. S. Fletcher
books.summary: A famous actor goes missing on the northern English sea coast.

books.title: The Economic Consequences of the Peace
books.author: John Maynard Keynes
books.summary: Keynes presents a first-hand account of the 1919 Paris Peace Conference and an analysis of the resulting Versailles treaty.

books.title: The Public and Its Problems
books.author: John Dewey
books.summary: A discussion of the political philosophy of a democratic society.

books.title: Poetry
books.author: T. S. Eliot
books.summary: A collection of T. S. Eliot’s poetry, including “The Love Song of J. Alfred Prufrock,” “The Waste Land,” and “The Hollow Men.”

books.title: The Works of Max Beerbohm
books.author: Max Beerbohm
books.summary: A collection of satirical essays ridiculing pretentiousness through imitation.

books.title: At the Earth’s Core
books.author: Edgar Rice Burroughs
books.summary: Two explorers burrow deep into the planet’s crust and emerge in a savage land inside a hollow Earth, where they have many adventures.

books.title: Short Fiction
books.author: Aleksandr Kuprin
books.summary: A collection of Aleksandr Kuprin’s translated short stories, ordered by date of publication.

books.title: Polynesian Mythology
books.author: George Grey
books.summary: A collection of Māori mythology covering the start of the universe through to the spread of Māori tribes through New Zealand’s North Island.

books.title: The Worst Journey in the World
books.author: Apsley Cherry-Garrard
books.summary: The travelogue of a member of Robert Scott’s ill-fated Antarctic expedition of 1910.
